item.title: Meg add a quote by Josh Billings
item.description: "About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment." -- Josh Billings

item.title: Meg add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Meg add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Meg add a quote by Benjamin Hoff
item.description: "Lots of people talk to animals...Not very many listen though...that's the problem." -- Benjamin Hoff

item.title: Meg add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Meg add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And now," cried Max, "let the wild rumpus start!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Meg add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Meg add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meg add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meg add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meg add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Meg add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Meg add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Meg add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Meg add a quote by Meg Mims
Meg add a quote by F.W. Dupee
item.description: "Progress always involves risk; you can't steal second base and keep your foot on first." -- F.W. Dupee

item.title: Meg add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Meg add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "That's what we storytellers do. We restore order with imagination. We instill hope again and again and again." ... Walt Disney, SAVING MR. BANKS" -- Walt Disney
